components.name: imageText
components.headline: _ Digital transformation
components.heading: What is an Enterprise Knowledge Graph and why should you be interested?
components.html: An Enterprise Knowledge Graph is a model of a knowledge domain created by subject-matter experts with the help of intelligent machine learning algorithms. It provides a structure and common interface for all of your data and enables the creation of smart multilateral relations throughout your databases. Structured as an additional virtual data layer, the Knowledge Graph lies on top of your existing databases or data sets to link all your data together at scale â€“ be it structured or unstructured.

components.name: quartet
components.heading: Performing models attribute their success to structured workflows

quarters.heading: 1 _ Understanding the field and defining the actors
quarters.description:
The first question should be what actors there are in the field that you are interested to research.
The actors can vary from real persons to concepts, from institutions to inanimate objects.

quarters.heading: 3 _ Detecting the relationships
quarters.description:
The second step is to come up with relations that make the interaction or some other relation possible between the actors. These will describe
every relation in your domain of interest.

quarters.heading: 3 _ Compiling data & building the graph
quarters.description: Gathering data from public sources to augment the existing will also expand your domain's knowledge and uncover hidden connections and patterns.

quarters.heading: 4 _ Reading & analyzing the graph
quarters.description: Using graph algorithms and constantly expanding the graph with new data and connections will improve your predictions accuracy and your business decision process.
